text: Clifford Ralph Robinson (December 16, 1966 â€“ August 29, 2020) was an American professional basketball player. He played 18 seasons in the National Basketball Association (NBA). He played the first eight seasons of his career with the Portland Trail Blazers, followed by the Phoenix Suns, Detroit Pistons, Golden State Warriors, and New Jersey Nets. Robinson received the NBA Sixth Man of the Year Award in 1993 and was selected as an NBA All-Star in 1994. He played college basketball for the UConn Huskies. In March 2019, he had surgery for lymphoma treatment.
